item.description:
Crow Hill is likely the best climbing in MA. Plenty of routes and a 90 foot tall wall in spots. This will be a joint event with Tim's group (a socializing meetup group.) We will picnic, play Frisbee and swim with the kids down by the pond. Some people might also hike.

We will have an informal (but safe) belay set up for new climbers. This will be from 11AM to 2PM at the practice wall (far right corner of the cliff.)

We will set up our ropes and climb about 3 hours. Please bring water, sunscreen, and any equipment that you might have. (I have an extra harness.)

We will meet for car pooling at 9 AM.
Meet at the big red wind mill sculpture at Porter Square T stop. Be on time.

Directions to Crow Hill. Find Leominster State Forest (www.state.ma.us/dem/parks/lmsf.htm). Take route 2 to rt 31 south (exit 28) go south 1.3 miles to park head quarters. There are two parking lots. Go to the first parking lot on the left and pay $5 dollars for the picnic area. I will be in this parking lot at 11AM then I will head up the hill. (Look for my small Silver Toyota.)
This should be a great day of outdoor fun and sun.
Smiles
Geoff
617 501-6217

PS Any experienced climbers who would like to help - please call me. Thanks.
item.how_to_find_us: I will wear a red shirt. Or call me 617 501-6217 (reception might be on/off at the hill.)
item.name: Crow Hill, top roping and Picnic. Great for Newbies.
